docs.title: Home
docs.text:
Welcome to the Hungovercoders Repo Tools documentation!

The live site can be found at hungovercoders.github.io/repo-tools.

docs.title: 💼 Other
docs.text:
• Initial commit (2025-05-24)

  • Add initial project structure with documentation and devcontainer setup

  • Created README.md with contributing and prerequisites sections

  • Added devcontainer.json for development environment configuration
  • Included requirements.txt for MkDocs dependencies
  • Configured Dependabot for dependency updates
  • Set up GitHub Actions workflow for deploying MkDocs to GitHub Pages
  • Enhanced .gitignore to exclude unnecessary files
  • Established initial documentation in docs/index.md and docs/log.md

  • Configured mkdocs.yml with material theme and markdown extensions (2025-05-24)

  • Update requirements and workflows for changelog generation and documentation deployment (2025-05-24)

  • Enhance changelog formatting and structure for clarity (2025-05-24)

  • Refactor documentation structure: enhance changelog clarity, add developer diary, and useful commands sections (2025-05-24)

  • Update GitHub Actions workflow to ensure full history is fetched during deployment (2025-05-24)

  • Add timestamps to changelog entries for better tracking (2025-05-24)

  • Add auto-tagging and publishing workflows for Python package, update useful commands, and define Python version (2025-05-24)

  • Enhance GitHub workflows: add GitHub authentication step in auto-tag workflow and streamline PyPI publish process by using 'uv' for package building (2025-05-24)

  • Granting permissions (2025-05-24)

docs.title: Developer Diary
docs.text: This document serves as a diary for the development of this package. It is intended to provide insights into the development process, decisions made, and tools used.

Setup

  • Setup a devcontainer.
  • Followed this blog for uv setup a package.

Tooling

  • Started to utilise uv for python project management.
  • Started to utilise git-cliff for changelog generation.

Docs

  • Installed mkdocs and created documentation in github pages.
  • Leverage mkdocs admonitions.
  • Added mkdocs-material theme.

Tooling

  • Add repo copilot prompt to ensure uses conventional commits.
  • Investigated coverage and pytest-cov for code coverage. Unsure which one to use.

docs.title: Useful Commands
docs.text:
python --version
uv --version
mkdocs gh-deploy
mkdocs serve
git-cliff -c cliff.toml
uv add requests
uv remove requests
uv lock --upgrade-package requests
uv build
uv init --lib my-package
pip install -e .
uvx ruff check --fix
